docs.snippet: HUGE sections of the Western Hemisphere find themselves represented in exhibitions about town just now: The United States, copiously, as usual, by group and one-man shows; some eighteen Latin-American countries, by prints at the Grand Central, and...
docs.lead_paragraph: HUGE sections of the Western Hemisphere find themselves represented in exhibitions about town just now: The United States, copiously, as usual, by group and one-man shows; some eighteen Latin-American countries, by prints at the Grand Central, and one of the South American nations, Peru, by water-color drawings of objects produced in pre-Columbian eras, this work displayed at the Riverside Museum.

docs.snippet: SINCE the Davis Cup was tucked away two years ago in an Australian silver vault for the duration, tennis sailing parties are few and far between and no one gets very excited when they go up the gangplank and the captain yanks out all the stops on the...
docs.lead_paragraph: SINCE the Davis Cup was tucked away two years ago in an Australian silver vault for the duration, tennis sailing parties are few and far between and no one gets very excited when they go up the gangplank and the captain yanks out all the stops on the horn.

docs.snippet: Jo Davidson, the sculptor, who returned yesterday from South America, where he executed busts of Presidents of nine republics, declared that the United States was on the verge of a renaissance in art. He said that WPA art projects had done much to...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jo Davidson, the sculptor, who returned yesterday from South America, where he executed busts of Presidents of nine republics, declared that the United States was on the verge of a renaissance in art. He said that WPA art projects had done much to make such a renaissance possible.

headline.main: DAVIDSON, BACK, SEES ART REBIRTH; Renaissance Made Possible by WPA, Says Sculptor, Home From South America GOOD-WILL TOUR IS ENDED He Expects to Complete Busts of 9 Heads of Republics in Bronze Soon

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 18 -- Official circles here believe that the more acute the international situation grows the more necessary it becomes for the United States to settle the oil expropriations issue. American observers agree that the negotiations...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Oct. 18 -- Official circles here believe that the more acute the international situation grows the more necessary it becomes for the United States to settle the oil expropriations issue. American observers agree that the negotiations between Mexico and the United States are closely linked with defense.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 -- Superficially, the United States relations with Latin America are good. The recent comprehensive trade agreement with Argentina and the sudden collapse of the pro-German regime in Panama support this view.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 18 -- Superficially, the United States relations with Latin America are good. The recent comprehensive trade agreement with Argentina and the sudden collapse of the pro-German regime in Panama support this view.
